meanings.definition: A small, usually hard structure produced by a plant that can grow into a new plant.
meanings.sent1: The seed was planted in the soil to grow a beautiful flower.
meanings.sent2: She carefully placed the seed in the pot and watered it daily.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the seed for a nut and tried to bury it.
meanings.sent4: His kind words were the seed that blossomed into a strong friendship.
meanings.sent5: The tiny seed held the promise of a mighty oak tree within.

meanings.definition: A cause or beginning of something.
meanings.sent1: The small act of kindness was the seed of a great change in the community.
meanings.sent2: The discovery of electricity was the seed of modern technology.
meanings.sent3: His joke at the party unknowingly planted the seed for a series of pranks.
meanings.sent4: The first note of the melody was the seed that grew into a beautiful song.
meanings.sent5: The initial idea was the seed that sparked a revolution in the industry.
